object.course_desc: An introductory course emphasizing the development of writing, research, and analytical skills through the concentrated investigation of selected topics in Public Affairs. Topics will be offered by various Departments within the Faculty of Public Affairs. Topics may vary from year to year.
object.course_extra_details:
Prerequisite(s): permission of the Department within the Faculty of Public Affairs.
Seminar three hours per week.
object.course_prerequisites: permission of the Department within the Faculty of Public Affairs.

object.course_desc: Related approaches to collecting, interpreting, and presenting quantitative information in the context of specific public policy issues such as immigration, globalization, discrimination, health care, and the environment. Development of fundamental logical, numerical, and statistical skills.
object.course_extra_details:
Prerequisite(s): Not open to students in any B.Com., B.C.S., B.Eng., B.I.B., B.I.D., B.Math., or B.Sc. program.
Lectures three hours a week, tutorials one and half hours a week.
object.course_prerequisites: Not open to students in any B.Com., B.C.S., B.Eng., B.I.B., B.I.D., B.Math., or B.Sc. program.

object.course_desc: Specialized topics in the area of public affairs. Topics vary from year to year and are posted at carleton.ca/fpa in advance of the registration period.
object.course_extra_details:
Prerequisite(s): Normally restricted to students in the second year of a B.P.A.P.M., B.G.In.S., B.Econ, B.J., B.Co.M.S., B.S.W., or B.A. program in the Faculty of Public Affairs.
Lecture three hours per week
object.course_prerequisites: Normally restricted to students in the second year of a B.P.A.P.M., B.G.In.S., B.Econ, B.J., B.Co.M.S., B.S.W., or B.A. program in the Faculty of Public Affairs.

object.course_desc: Specialized topics in the area of public affairs. Topics vary from year to year and are posted at carleton.ca/fpa in advance of the registration period.
object.course_extra_details:
Prerequisite(s): Normally restricted to students in the third year of a B.P.A.P.M., B.G.In.S., B.Econ, B.J., B.Co.M.S., B.S.W., or B.A. program in the Faculty of Public Affairs.
Lecture three hours per week.
object.course_prerequisites: Normally restricted to students in the third year of a B.P.A.P.M., B.G.In.S., B.Econ, B.J., B.Co.M.S., B.S.W., or B.A. program in the Faculty of Public Affairs.

object.course_desc: Seminar on a specialized topic in the area of public affairs. Topics will vary from year to year and are posted at carleton.ca/fpa in advance of the registration period.
object.course_extra_details:
Prerequisite(s): fourth-year Honours standing or permission of the instructor.
Seminar three hours per week.
object.course_prerequisites: fourth-year Honours standing or permission of the instructor.

object.course_desc: This course gives students an opportunity to participate in a research project designed by a faculty member. Students gain work experience, learn new materials, and acquire research-oriented skills. Course expectations, learning outcomes and evaluation criteria are established by the supervising faculty member.
object.course_extra_details:
Includes: Experiential Learning Activity
Prerequisite(s): third year honours standing, GPA of 9.5 and permission of department.
object.course_prerequisites: third year honours standing, GPA of 9.5 and permission of department.
